extendedInfo.description: The battle of Gettysburg was fought over 3 days from July 1st-3rd 1863. It is considered the turning point of the American civil war, showing that the Confederates were not invincible, halting the invasion of the North, and providing the political popularity for Lincoln to be re-elected as president.This wargame allows you to play either side against the computer, or hotseat against another player. There is a map of the Gettysburg battlefield divided into hexagons, each representing about 500 yards across. The combat units are brigades, with each figure representing 100 men or 10 guns.Victory is achieved by the capture of flagged areas on the map (the flag indicates ownership) and also inflicting more losses.The game can be played with fog of war on or off, and options can be set for when the tardy Confederate cavalry commander, General Stuart, shows up (although this will also affect his Union cavalry counterparts).Game copyright Dave Kershaw, DK Simulations Ltd 2012.Artwork by Gonzalo Santacruz

reviews.title: Gettysburg & Bull Run
reviews.comment: Two great games. Highly suggest both. My only problem on Samsung 7.7 is that both games freeze every third or fourth game around turn 10. Any suggestions. Definite 5 rating without freeze up.
reviews.author: Dennis Holkovic

reviews.title: Broken
reviews.comment: Does not open on nexus for me want refund please. bull run works fine and is a good game though
reviews.author: Danny Corbin

reviews.title: Great wargame
reviews.comment: Fun to play a quick runthrough. Repetitive with the one battle and no options.  Worth buying if you are into these types of games.
reviews.author: Josh Laughlin

reviews.title: solid wargaming for history fans
reviews.comment: Just played [b]Battle of Gettysburg[/b] last night. The Graphics are basic but fine, not sure I like top down views. AI and back ground \'mechanics\' all seem to work authentically. Its cool to see the Generals and their units move, and see the log file updating, with losses morale degradation, and unit strength. The map looks good but it is a bit hard to tell hill tops given the crowded terrain. Once or twice I thought I was holding a hill, only to see larger than normal losses due t being charged down hill! ugh.  Arty is not very powerful, AI was smart enuff to avoid frontal assaults on it :( REALLY need an UNDO move button/option.  I like the movement indicators and how far you can move being shaded in. A couple of times I rolled back a turn to see if the AI would do the same thing twice. Never does. I think I like that from a replay perspective, plus the results of combats where they were the same also varied!  I feel like I got some good value at 1.99. And it is now on my radar to watch for new releases. If the designer teamed up with a UI/animation guy that would be very cool.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Build this out
reviews.comment: This system,and the Napoleonic, have great potential. Both need more depth though.  Would love to see a naval campaign. Vicksburg,even.
reviews.author: Sean Winkel

reviews.title: Dan Yankees
reviews.comment: Excellent game. Reminds me of the old Civil War Generals game. Great game for any wargame fan and I a must have for any civil war fan.
reviews.author: Dave Maddy

reviews.title: Gettysburg Great Game Play
reviews.comment: I have looking for a game app similar to the Classic Civil War Generals and this is as close as it gets! Ready for First and Second Manassas next!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Love this game downloaded there bull run game as well cant wait for you to put out another battle....Fredricksburg would be Awsome. Maybe even Sharpsburg
reviews.author: Robert Carroll

reviews.title: Gettysburg 1863
reviews.comment: Downloaded game on Razor and freezes on first touch.  Please assist. Confederates win on first day by Pender and Heath taking Round Tops and Power Hill. This can be done uncontested by AI. Only need to take Gettysburg. Suggest playing into second day.
reviews.author: Matt White
